title: Far-right activist's shocking rant on Channel 4 News: 'Take in a Syrian refugee, I hope you don't get raped':

A far-right activist told a student campaigner "take in a Syrian refugee, I hope you don't get raped" in a shocking rant during a debate on Channel 4 News . 
Ex-BNP member Jack Buckby, who last year stood in the by-election triggered by Labour MP Jo Cox's murder, prompted gasps in the studio with a furious outburst at Barbara Ntumy. 
The pair were both panelists on a discussion about the so-called "alt right" on the channel's evening news programme tonight. 
Buckby launched into an angry tirade after Ntumy, a political activist from the National Union of Students black studentsâ€™ campaign, questioned his claim that he only wanted "people who are drain on society" to be deported from the UK. Rightwing activist Jack Buckby says 'take in a Syrian refugee I hope you don't get raped' in shocking Channel 4 News rant (Photo: Channel 4) Rightwing activist Jack Buckby says 'take in a Syrian refugee I hope you don't get raped' in shocking Channel 4 News rant (Photo: Channel 4) 
After Ntumy asked "who gets to decide who is a drain on society", the right-winger accused her of "faux outrage" and produced a form to apply for Syrian refugees. Read More Jack Buckby in his campaign video ahead of the Batley and Spen by-election last year 
Buckby said: "You know what, put your money where your mouth is - Syrian refugees application form. 
"Take one home, take in a Syrian refugee. I hope you don't get raped." Rightwing activist Jack Buckby says 'take in a Syrian refugee I hope you don't get raped' in shocking Channel 4 News rant (Photo: Channel 4) Rightwing activist Jack Buckby says 'take in a Syrian refugee I hope you don't get raped' in shocking Channel 4 News rant (Photo: Channel 4) 
Ntumy was briefly left open-mouthed and apparently speechless by the outburst, while a male voice elsewhere in the studio could be heard exclaiming: "Oh my God." 
Krishnan Guru-Murthy later branded Buckby producing the application form a "stunt", adding: "Let's just ignore that." Read More 
Buckby ran for anti-Islam party Liberty GB in Batley and Span despite the major parties opting not contest the seat following the Labour MP's killing by far-right extremist Thomas Mair. 
He received 220 votes. 
Set up in 2013, Liberty GB wants to ban all immigration to Britain for 5 years, scrap all government equality quangos and reverse "the Islamisation of Britain". Like us on Facebook
